title: CIA Triad and Information Assurance
excerpt: Details the core model of information security (CIA Triad) and the general practice of Information Assurance.

full_content.heading: The CIA Triad (The Foundational Model)
full_content.text: The **CIA Triad** is the core model in information security, guiding policies and practices to protect critical information and ensure system reliability.

full_content.heading: Confidentiality
full_content.intro: Information must only be available to **authorized parties**. Violations include unauthorized access or disclosure.
points: Examples of protected data: Personal data, Healthcare Records, Intellectual Property.
Techniques used: Passwords, Two-factor authentication (2FA), Data Encryption.

full_content.heading: Integrity
full_content.intro: Information must remain **consistent, trustworthy, and accurate**.
points: Examples: Bank Transactions, Document Editing, Online Reviews, Database Management.
Techniques used: Data Validation, Version Control, Hashing/Checksums.

full_content.heading: Availability
full_content.intro: Information must remain **accessible** to authorized parties even during failures.
points: Techniques used: DDoS Protection, Backups, Load Balancers.
